SEARCH
Package env

Class BlackForestGameMap

java.lang.Object
env.BlackForestGameMap
public class BlackForestGameMap extends Object
The `BlackForestGameMap` class represents the spatial structure of the game environment. It contains the methods and data structures used by `BlackForestModel` to manage terrain, resources, structures and agents. This class provides essential functionalities such as pathfinding, obstacle detection, and environmental state updates, making it a key component for the simulation logic.

    • spawnAgent

      public boolean spawnAgent(Agent agent)
      Spawns an agent on a random cell at a designated team base. If its HP is less than 0, the agent is marked as dead and removed.
      Parameters:
      agent - The agent to spawn.
      Returns:
      True if the agent was successfully spawned, false otherwise.

    • resetAgent

      public boolean resetAgent(Agent agent)
      Resets an agent's state by restoring its HP to the maximum and setting it to the spawn state.
      Parameters:
      agent - The agent to reset.
      Returns:
      True if the agent was successfully reset.

      newPosition - The target position.
      newOrientation - The target orientation.
      Returns:
      True if the agent was successfully moved, false otherwise.

      target - The gate to repair.
      Returns:

      range - The maximum distance to check.
      Returns:
      A set of neighboring agents.

    • getGateNeighbours

      public Set<Gate> getGateNeighbours(Agent agent, String team, int range)
      Retrieves a set of gates that are within a specified range of the given agent, based on team affiliation.
      Parameters:
      agent - The reference agent.
      team - The team filter ("enemy" or "ally").
      range - The maximum distance to check.
      Returns:
      A set of gates matching the criteria.

      range - The maximum distance to check.
      Returns:

    • getPrincessNeighbours

    • getAgentSurroundingPositions

      Retrieves a mapping of the positions surrounding the specified agent in relation to its current direction.
      Parameters:
      agent - The reference agent.
      Returns:
      A map of surrounding positions indexed by direction.

    • getClosestObjectiveSoldier

      public Pair<String,Vector2D> getClosestObjectiveSoldier(Agent agent)
      Determines the closest objective for a soldier agent based on its current state and the game's overall state (including princess scenarios). This method implements the core soldier AI logic, defining the sequence of actions from spawning to capturing the enemy princess or rescuing the ally princess. It also handles game over conditions.
      Parameters:
      agent - the soldier agent for which to determine the closest objective
      Returns:
      a Pair containing the next state name and target position, or null if no objective can be determined (e.g., invalid state).

    • getClosestObjectiveGatherer

      public Pair<String,Vector2D> getClosestObjectiveGatherer(Agent agent)
      Determines the closest objective for a gatherer agent based on its current state and the game's overall state (including princess and gate scenarios). This method implements the core gatherer AI logic, defining the sequence of actions from spawning to gathering wood, repairing gates, and eventually transitioning to soldier behavior. It also handles game over conditions.
      Parameters:
      agent - the gatherer agent for which to determine the closest objective
      Returns:
      a Pair containing the next state name and target position, or null if no objective can be determined (e.g., invalid state).

    • getClosestObjective

      public Pair<String,Vector2D> getClosestObjective(Agent agent)
      Determines the closest objective for the given agent, dispatching to the appropriate handler method based on the agent's type (soldier or gatherer).
      Parameters:
      agent - the agent for which to determine the closest objective
      Returns:
      a Pair containing the next state name and target position, or null if the agent type is not recognized.

    • getWoodAmountRed

      public AtomicInteger getWoodAmountRed()
      Gets the current amount of wood held by the red team.
      Returns:
      an AtomicInteger representing the red team's wood amount.

    • getWoodAmountBlue

      public AtomicInteger getWoodAmountBlue()
      Gets the current amount of wood held by the blue team.
      Returns:
      an AtomicInteger representing the blue team's wood amount.

      Returns:
      an Optional containing the gate if found, or an empty Optional if not.

    • getPrincessByName

      public Optional<Princess> getPrincessByName(String pName)

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • getAllCells

      public List<Cell> getAllCells(Zone zoneType, Class<? extends MapStructure> structureClass, Predicate<MapStructure> structurePredicate, Class<? extends Resource> resourceClass, Predicate<Resource> resourcePredicate, Class<? extends Agent> agentClass, Predicate<Agent> agentPredicate, boolean includeMatching)
      Returns a list of cells based on filtering criteria. This method allows for flexible filtering of cells based on their zone type, contained structures, contained resources, and contained agents. Predicates can be used to further refine the filtering based on specific properties of these elements.
      Parameters:
      zoneType - Optional zone type to filter by (can be null for no zone filtering).
      structureClass - Optional class type of structure to filter by (can be null for no structure filtering).
      structurePredicate - Optional predicate to filter structures by specific fields (can be null for no structure predicate filtering).
      resourceClass - Optional class type of resource to filter by (can be null for no resource filtering).
      resourcePredicate - Optional predicate to filter resources by specific fields (can be null for no resource predicate filtering).
      agentClass - Optional class type of agent to filter by (can be null for no agent filtering).
      agentPredicate - Optional predicate to filter agents by specific fields (can be be null for no agent predicate filtering).
      includeMatching - If true, returns cells *matching* the criteria; if false, returns the *complement* (cells *not* matching).
      Returns:
      A List of cells filtered according to the specified criteria, ordered in raster scan order (row by row, left to right).

    • getCellByPosition

      public Cell getCellByPosition(int x, int y)
      Retrieves the cell at the specified coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the cell.
      y - the y-coordinate of the cell.
      Returns:
      the Cell at the specified coordinates, or null if the coordinates are outside the map boundaries.

    • getCellByPosition

      public Cell getCellByPosition(Vector2D position)
      Retrieves the cell at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      position - the Vector2D representing the position of the cell.
      Returns:
      the Cell at the specified position, or null if the position is outside the map boundaries.

    • isPositionInside

      public boolean isPositionInside(int x, int y)
      Checks if a given position is within the boundaries of the map.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the position.
      y - the y-coordinate of the position.
      Returns:
      true if the position is inside the map, false otherwise.
